question.title: How to Capture a WebView Screenshot with a Specific Height and Width Starting from the Top-Left Corner?
question.body:
I’m building a custom browser in my Android application and need to take a screenshot of each tab when a web page loads.

Currently, I’m using the following method to capture the screenshot:

public Bitmap tabScreenShot(Context context) {
    WebView webView = new WebView(context);
    return new Screenshot().takeWebView(webView, height, width);
}

📝 Issue 1: Blank Space in Screenshot

  • If the loaded web page has content only on the top half and the bottom half is blank (white space), the screenshot captures this blank space as well.

  • This results in an undesirable half-white page, which doesn’t look visually appealing when generating thumbnails for the tabs.

📝 Issue 2: Capturing the Visible View After Scrolling

  • In some cases, users scroll the page to the bottom (into the white space area). When this happens, the screenshot captures whatever is currently shown in the WebView, which is just a blank space.

🎯 Goal: I want to modify the screenshot behavior to:

  1. Capture a screenshot for a given height and width.
  2. Always capture the screenshot starting from the top-left corner of the loaded webpage, regardless of the scroll position.
  3. Minimize or completely avoid capturing unnecessary blank space at the bottom.

By doing this, I aim to minimize the amount of blank/white space captured, thereby improving the visual quality of the generated thumbnails.

❓ Questions:

  1. Is there a way to capture a screenshot starting from the top-left corner of the WebView’s content, even if the user scrolls down to the bottom?
  2. Can I force the WebView to scroll to the top programmatically before taking the screenshot to avoid capturing unwanted blank space?
  3. Is there an alternative approach that ensures a clean, well-cropped screenshot from the top of the webpage?
